description.value: A record of a medication that has been or is being consumed by a patient.

definition.value:
The overall period the patient needs to start taking the prescribed medicine.
It is constituted of 3 optional subfields: start date, end date, length of treatment. End date and length of treatment are mutually exclusive.

Instruction on number of units per intake, frequency of intakes (per day/month or week) and duration of treatment.
Country of treatment translates the posology from Country of affiliation to Country of treatment units, but it must be the same posology. This field can be a single field or a block of different fields: Number of units per intake, frequency of intakes (per day/month/week) and duration of treatment.
Example: 1 unit/intake every 24 hrs for a duration of 30 days in country A can be 1unit/intake, once a day, during 1 month.
When Posology is a single field, information that should be present in the optional fields, is expected to be present in the single field as free text.
Description of a Product as used in a medication summary

The duration for which the patient should take the medicine with that dosage. In the majority of the cases it coincides with the overall duration. Example: During 14 days. This attribute is part of the posology. It is constituted of 3 optional subfields: start date, end date, length of treatment. End date and length of treatment are mutually exclusive.

The number of units for each intake that the patient is taking.
Example: 1 tablet.
This attribute is part of the posology.

Frequency of the intakes that the patient should take (per hour/day/month/ week).
Example: Each month. This attribute is part of the posology.

Indicates the part of the body through or into which, or the way in which, the medicinal product is intended to be introduced. In some cases a medicinal product can be intended for more than one route and/or method of administration.
Country of treatment translates the route of administration from Country of affiliation to Country of treatment units, but it is the same route.
Example: In injectable: intramuscular. In tablet: oral.
